title: VP of Sales Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at CareMessage in Dec 2022
Interview Descriptions: A JOKE! Vineet the CEO reached out to me to interview for their VP of Sales role. He was 3 minutes late to the Zoom meeting. He didn't turn his camera on. Vineet starts by saying I have a couple questions for you, then I'm going to turn the time over to you. I now understand why they have awful reviews, and his employees don't like him. Vineet doesn't know how to run an interview, I'm worried how he is running a company.
Interview Questions: What do you need in your next role?

title: VP of Sales Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at CareMessage in Sept 2022
Interview Descriptions: There were 5 interviews scheduled, spread across multiple leaders and including an executive case study. They do a lot of vetting for this role, and I was excited about the challenge of crushing every interview. Interviews themselves weren't too bad, and were standard stuff. But, after leading me on for the entire process, they called and said they weren't moving forward with me for "people management" reasons. I literally have a degree in people management, and the team and job scope here is smaller than my current one. It seems they're hiding real reasons for not wanting to move forward, but I'm not surprised anymore after reading other interview reviews and employee reviews. Don't expect transparency from this company. Proceed with caution.
Interview Questions: How do you embrace diversity and inclusion in your current role?
